rev.comment: /* Google files for GPhone paymnet patent */
rev.diff:
Line 133: Line 133:
Google has applied for a patent for a mobile payment system <ref> [http://www.mobilemarketingnews.co.uk/GPhone_rumours_escalate_with_new_patent_18267149.html Google files for gPhone paymnet patent] according to [http://www.Mobilemarketingnews.co.uk Mobilemarketingnews.co.uk] </ref> to complement is plans to launch the Google phone, or [[GPhone]].
Google has applied for a patent for a mobile payment system <ref> [http://www.mobilemarketingnews.co.uk/GPhone_rumours_escalate_with_new_patent_18267149.html Google files for gPhone paymnet patent] according to [http://www.Mobilemarketingnews.co.uk Mobilemarketingnews.co.uk] </ref> to complement is plans to launch the Google phone, or [[GPhone]].
â
Known as 'GPay', it covers a system that would let the user sends a text message to Google giving the details of a payment to a specified recipient. GPay then debits the user's bank account, crediting the money to the payee.
+
Known as 'GPay', it covers a system that would let people pay for services using text messages.
